config_description: /** * Database setting OPTIMIZE_SIMPLE_SINGLE_ROW_SUBQUERIES (default: true). * Optimize expressions of the form (SELECT A) to A. */
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration OPTIMIZE_SIMPLE_SINGLE_ROW_SUBQUERIES is used to optimize expressions of the form (SELECT A) to A in the code. When the configuration is enabled in the database settings, the code checks if the query is a constant query, and if it is, it returns the value expression. It also checks for single-row subqueries and optimizes them if the condition is met.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the configuration OPTIMIZE_SIMPLE_SINGLE_ROW_SUBQUERIES depends on the usage of single-row subqueries in the queries. If there are many single-row subqueries in the system, this configuration will be triggered more frequently.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling the configuration OPTIMIZE_SIMPLE_SINGLE_ROW_SUBQUERIES can have a positive impact on the system performance by optimizing the expressions and reducing the overhead of executing single-row subqueries. However, if the system does not have many single-row subqueries, the impact of this configuration may be minimal.
